title: How (Not) To Bale Hay : Busted Belts

tasks.task: Navigating and Handling Farm Equipment During Hay Bailing
subtasks: Starting and operating agricultural machinery (tractor and baler)
Adjusting speed and gearshifts for efficient operation
Overcoming physical challenges (managing heavy hay bales)
Implementing safety measures (securing gates, protecting livestock)
Adjusting to weather conditions impacting farming activities

tasks.task: Interacting with Family and Staff on Farm Tasks
subtasks: Assisting in agricultural duties under supervision
Ensuring safety and well-being of staff during operations

tasks.task: Managing Hay Baling and Field Operations
subtasks: Overseeing hay cutting and baling processes
Coordinating equipment maintenance and repair assistance
Adjusting field work schedules due to unexpected delays
Evaluating the quality and quantity of baled hay

tasks.task: Dealing with Agricultural Stress and Time Management
subtasks: Managing time constraints and efficiency during peak farming seasons
Coping with equipment failures and downtime
Prioritizing tasks and adaptation to changing circumstances
Seeking solutions and support from family and staff
